elements.title: COLLECT S FOR THE CHURCH YEAR
elements.text: First Sunday in Advent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You, we bless and praise You, that You did show us poor sinners mercy, who for our transgressions did justly deserve to remain in the bondage of sin and Satan, and did gave us in Jesus Christ a meek and righteous King, who by His death became our Savior from sin and eternal death. We ask You to enlighten, govern and direct us by Your Holy Spirit, that we may ever remain faithful to this righteous King and Savior and not after the manner of the world, be offended with His humble form and despised word, but firmly believing in Him obtain eternal salvation; through the same Your beloved Son, Jesus Christ, our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, come now with your power among us and cast away every evil thing that may stop us from seeing the sign of your coming. We implore you to help us through your Holy Spirit to guard ourselves from every temptation. Help us not to be carried away by marrying, drunkenness and the cares of the world that your day will take us unaware, but we should always be prepared in prayer and be hopeful as we await the coming of our savior Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Second Sunday in Advent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, who by Your Son have revealed to us that heaven and earth shall pass away, that our bodies shall rise again, and that we all shall appear before the judgment seat: We implore You, keep us by Your Holy Spirit in Your Word; establish us ins the true faith, graciously defend us from sin and preserve us in all temptations, that our hearts may not be overcharged with surfeiting and drunkenness, and cares of this life, but that we may ever watch and pray, and trusting fully in Your grace, await with joy the glorious coming of Your Son, and at last obtain eternal salvation, through Your beloved Son, Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for accepting to come to the world in your Son Jesus Christ. Even though we are a little flock, you have admonished us not to be afraid because you delight to give us the kingdom. We implore you to come into our hearts and hear our prayers, change our behavior so that we may become your saved children. Let the light of your word shine in our hearts that we will become children of light and live with all the saints through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Third Sunday in Advent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who did suffer Your Son, our Lord, Jesus Christ to become man, and to come into the world, that He might destroy the works of the devil, deliver us poor offenders from sin and death, and give us everlasting life: We beseech You to rule and govern our hearts by Your Holy Spirit, that we may seek no other refuge than His Word, and thus avoid all offense to which by nature we are inclined, in order that we may always be found among the faithful followers of Your Son, Jesus Christ, and by faith in Him obtain eternal salvation, through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for your grace and mercy toward us, for on our own we are unable to come to you, but you agree to humble yourself to come to us even to the point of becoming a man in order to save us. We implore you to help us, strengthen us and give us power to testify that your son Jesus Christ is the only savior without fear. Let your spirit stir the hearts of our hearers to believe and accept Jesus as their savior. Hear these prayers for the glory of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives, and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Fourth Sunday in Advent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, it is proper and right that we should give thanks unto You, that You have given us a more glorious baptism than that of John the Baptist, and have therein promised us the gift of forgiveness with You and the Holy Spirit and life everlasting, through Your Son Jesus Christ: Preserve us we pray You, in such faith in Your grace and mercy that we may never doubt Your promise, but be comforted by the same in all temptations: and grant us Your Holy Spirit that we may renounce sin and ever continue in the righteousness bestowed upon us in baptism until by Your grace we obtain eternal salvation, through the same, Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for the fulfillment of your promise of the world s salvation through your Son Jesus Christ our savior. We implore you to open our eyes to see this great act of grace you have done unto us. Lord give us the spirit of praise and worship that we will proclaim Christ throughout our life on earth, to keep praising you, glorifying you for this great work of salvation you have wrought for us through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Christmas Eve

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
A&B
O lord our heavenly Father, we thank You that of Your great goodness and mercy You have caused Your only begotten Son to become partaker of our flesh and blood, that we through Him might be redeemed from sin and everlasting death; and we pray You; enlighten our hearts that we may be truly thankful to You for His gracious Incarnation and birth, that we may be comforted by the same in all time of tribulation and temptation, and in the end be saved with an everlasting salvation, through the same Your dear Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit for ever and ever. Amen
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, you who brought us salvation today. We come to you in calmness to fill our hearts with prayers that will occupy thoughts. Help us to observe this Christmas Eve with thankful hearts, to get many blessings. Fill us with the true meaning of Christmas that brings joy and salvation to the world today, wherefore you forgive us all our sins and grant us eternal life. Cause the true meaning of Christmas enter our hearts that we may know that salvation has come to us. We thank you for bringing us light that drives away all darkness from us, and have allow us see this day. Help us to glorify you as we celebrate this Christmas in demonstration of the light you brought for the salvation of the world. Sanctify us and make us your everlasting children through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God world without end. Amen.
Christmas Day (Nativity of our Lord)

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we give thanks unto You, that of Your great mercy and compassion You did suffer Your dear Son to become incarnate, and through Him redeem us from sin and everlasting death; We implore You, enlighten our hearts by Your Holy Spirit, that we may ever be thankful for such grace, and comfort ourselves with the same in all tribulation and temptation, and at last obtain eternal salvation through the same Your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, you who created everything in the world and saw that it is good. You created man in your image and likeness. But because of disobedience, man fell into sin and died spiritually. However, because of your unfailing love, you planned the coming of Jesus into the world to save mankind. We thank you for the salvation you have given us. Through your humility in Christ we can now come before you with joy and thanks because of your grace to us. We thank you for how the shepherds proclaimed your birth. We ask you to strengthen us in this faith that you are our eternal savior. At the end to ever remain blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Sunday after Christmas

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, mercifully direct our ways that we may walk in your law, and be made to abound in good works through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
C: Most gracious God, teach us your love through it that we may know the kind of love you loved the world with to the extent that you sent your only beloved Son. We implore you to open our eyes just as you promise Simeon that he will not die till he see your beloved Son Let your people all over the world glorify him in their hearts and lives. Help us to always be grateful through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
New Year s Eve

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty God, most gracious Father, from Whom we do constantly receive all manner of good which we have in no wise merited, we give You thanks that in the year which is now drawing to a close, You have so graciously and mighty protected us, and have bestowed upon us so many blessings both temporal and spiritual, and we pray You, enable us by Your Holy Spirit to acknowledge all these Your benefits, that we may evermore thank and praise You for Your goodness and mercy; through our Lord Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God Almighty, help us to know that our end and all the days of our life are known to you. As it is with the past year so it is with our days they pass by till the day we shall be called to be with you. O Lord, from you we came forth, we also look for refuge in you. Cause us to see this great love and grace in this coming year as you did in the year that has just past, that we may depend on your unchanging love and amend our ways. That way we will please you whenever you knock at our doors to take us home with you in your everlasting kingdom. We implore you to guide us in this coming year with your loving hand unto eternal life through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
New Year

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O merciful and eternal God, heavenly Father Who did cause Your Son to become incarnate and to be made subject to the law, that we might be redeemed from the curse of the law: We implore You, grant us grace to become partakers of this redemption and thus obtain eternal salvation through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ, our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Or
Almighty and everlasting God, from Whom comes down every good and perfect gift; we give You thanks for all Your temporal and spiritual benefits bestowed upon us in the year past, and we implore You of Your goodness, grant us a favorable and joyful year, defend us from all dangers and adversities, and send upon us the fullness of Your blessing; through Jesus Christ Your Son our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, ever one God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God, because of you we are not consumed, because of your pity we are not made slaves. Your love is new every day. Come dwell with us through out this year and guide us in everything. In our shortcoming and frailty, help us. Forgive our sins. Visit your elect church and build her yourself so she can stand in this New Year. Nourish her with your word and Sacrament. Look upon our country with favor and love and the entire world with your love; fill her with your wisdom. Fill our world leaders and advisers with the thoughts of leading with your fear. We bring the world , the Church, our families and ourselves before you, come among us with your power, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Sunday after New Year

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Lord God our heavenly Father, Who did suffer your dear Son Jesus Christ to become a stranger and sojourner in Egypt for our sakes, and did lead Him safe home to His fatherland. Mercifully grant that we poor sinners who are strangers and sojourners in this perilous world may soon be called home to our true fatherland, the kingdom of heaven, where we shall live in eternal joy and glory through the merits of Your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for showing us your glory and love, lead us through faith unto your work in Jesus Christ our Lord. We thank you for through your love you allowed Jesus Christ to come into the world to redeem us from the trap of Satan. We thank you for the blood of Jesus Christ which become our garment of salvation granting us joy and cleansing from our sins and are enabled to put on the clothe of righteousness, we who are not fit to come before you because of our sins. We implore you to pour your grace and eternal peace unto us. Strengthen this faith in us that we may not doubt this, your salvation to us in Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
The Epiphany of our Lord

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who has given us the light of Your holy Word, the guiding star which leads us to the Christ child: Send we implore You, Your Holy Spirit into our hearts that we may receive this light and make use of it unto our salvation, and that we like the wise men, they were seeking the star, may not be afraid because of any hardship and peril, but put all our trust in Your only begotten Son Jesus Christ our Lord as our only Savior; devote our earthly possessions to the advancement of Your kingdom, and in all things serve Him, Your only begotten, Son, Jesus, Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God our heavenly Father, we thank you for through your grace you revealed your Son to the world through the star from the East. We implore you to help us through your Holy Spirit such that we will be light in the world and bring people to your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
First Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who in mercy has established the Christian home among us. We implore you to rule and direct our hearts, that we may be good examples to children and servants, and not offend them by word or deed, but faithfully teach them to love Your Church and hear your blessed Word. Give them Your Spirit and grace, that this seed may bring forth good fruit so that our home life may conduce to Your glory, honor and praise, to our own improvement and welfare, and give offense to no one; through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, cause us to love you and one another. Help us to love our enemies for this is your command to us. On our own we do not have this kind of love that is why we humbly come to you for help. Help all Christians to desire to glorify your name in their life on earth and live according to your will in Jesus Christ your beloved Son our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Second Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You that of Your grace You have instituted holy matrimony. We implore You to send Your blessing upon every husband and wife that they may not provoke each other to anger and strife but live peaceably together in love and godliness, receive Your gracious help in all temptations, and bring up their children in accordance with Your will; grant unto us all to walk before You in purity and holiness, to put all our trust in You, and lead such lives on earth, that in the world to come we may have everlasting life through the same, Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, you who have the water of eternal life, we ask you to create this fountain of living water in us. Draw us closer to you through your grace and give us drink when we are thirsty. Plant us in fountains of living water. We implore you to help us understand that you alone have the gift of life which we do not have to buy, for this life is given free in your blood that was poured for us. At the end be ever blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Third Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, mercifully look upon our infirmities and in all our dangers and necessities stretch forth the right hand of your majesty to help and defend us; through Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, ever one God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for you are merciful. You have no desire in the death of a sinner but that the sinner receives the gift of salvation you brought for the world. We pray that you uphold us in your saving hands that we may not perish. Take away pride from our hearts and help us know that it is by your grace alone we will be saved. We ask that you help us when temptation and troubles befall us because of our weakness. We are unable to stand on our own, without you we are doomed, one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Fourth Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who in Your divine wisdom and fatherly goodness made Your children to bear the cross and send divers afflictions upon us to subdue the flesh and quicken our hearts unto faith, hope and unceasing prayer: We implore You to have mercy upon us and graciously deliver us out of our trials and temptations so that we may perceive Your grace and fatherly help, and with all saints forever praise and worship You; through Your dear Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God Almighty and our savior Jesus Christ, you who redeemed your children Israel, we equally believe you will save us in times of troubles. We accept that you created us according to your will treat us as you wish. Put in our hearts to love one another as you have loved us. Let us not doubt the salvation you brought to us even though Peter doubted when he saw the water currents waging against him, yet you saved him. We believe you will do same to us. Do not treat us according to our ways, but your grace and love, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Fifth Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You that You have sown the good seed, Your holy word, in our hearts: We pray You that by Your Holy Spirit You will cause this seed to grow and bring forth fruit and defend us from the enemy, that we may not sow tares therein. Keep us from carnal security, help us in all temptations and give us at last eternal salvation; through your beloved Son, Who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God our heavenly Father, we present ourselves in your hands to correct and mould us. Cause us to realize that you alone deserve our worship. Help us choose you not the gods of our fathers that we have left behind. Help us to remember your grace unto us while we were yet sinners. Let us not harden our hearts as the children of Israel did in the wilderness. Lord Jesus Christ, hide us under your cross because of your Love and mercy unto us. These we ask in the name of your Son Jesus Christ who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit from now and forever. Amen.
Sixth Sunday after Epiphany

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O merciful and everlasting God, heavenly Father: We thank You that You have revealed unto us the glory of Your Son, and let the Light of Your Gospel shine upon us: We pray You, guide us by this light that we may walk diligently as Christians in all good works, ever be strengthened by Your grace and conduct our lives in all godliness: through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we ask you to cause us shine in our earthly life. Lord Jesus Christ, we thank you for calling us to be living lamps that shine in this world. We implore you to help us not to judge others unjustly rather to judge justly that we may be faithful witnesses. Through our faith in Jesus Christ who is the light of the world help us to walk as children of the light not darkness. At the end remain ever blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Septuagesima Sunday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who through Your holy Word has called us unto Your vineyard: Send, that we may labor faithfully in Your vineyard, shun sin and all offense, obediently keep Your word and do Your will, and put our whole and only trust in Your grace, which You have bestowed upon us so plenteously through Your Son Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our Lord and heavenly Father, thank you for allowing us to depend on you, you have also bless our stay, you who created us in your likeness to do your will. We implore you to stop us from relying on man and not to be self centered. Fill us with the spirit of humility and love which will make us victorious through your Son Jesus Christ. Remove the thought focusing on what we will gain in following you from us, instead to believe that we will gain a hundredfold of everything we left behind. For you honors the one who has to have. Fill us with your spirit who witnessed his resurrection and forgive us where we have doubted and denied you in our life because of your love, mercy and grace unto us through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Sexagesima Sunday

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
A&B
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You that through Your Son Jesus Christ, You have sown Your holy word among us: We pray that You will prepare our hearts by Your Holy Spirit, that we may diligently and reverently hear Your Word, keep it in good hearts and bring forth fruit with patience; and that we may not incline to sin, but comfort ourselves with Your grace and continual help, through Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, ever one God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God our heavenly Father, thank you for sending your Son Jesus Christ who is the word of the Holy Spirit through whom you gave us eternal life. We implore you to help us whenever we read your word to believe that you are the one speaking to us. Lord Holy Spirit, help us to comprehend your message that was written with your help, you are the one who inspired the Apostles who wrote it. Whenever we read it, let your spirit guide us understand that you gave us life through your word and through this same your word, you will give life to those who do not know you; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Quinquagesima Sunday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who did manifest Yourself, with the Holy Spirit in the fullness of grace at the baptism of Your dear Son, and with Your voice did direct us to him who has borne our sins, that we might receive grace and the remission of sins; Keep us, we implore You, in the true faith; and inasmuch as we have been baptized in accordance with Your command, and the example of Your dear Son, we pray You to strengthen our faith by Your Holy Spirit, and lead us to everlasting life and salvation, through Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit; One true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God our heavenly Father; thank you for redeeming us through the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead. We implore you to preserve us from sin and worldly desires. Fill us with the spirit of love so that we will love you as you loved us. Encourage us not to be afraid when we are taken to the civil authorities. Protect us from falling into Satan s temptation, but fill us with love for you and our neighbors. These we ask through Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
First Sunday in Lent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, inasmuch as the adversary do continually afflict us, and as a roaring lion do walk about seeking to devour us: We implore You for the sake of the suffering and death of Jesus Christ Your Son to help us by the grace of the Holy Spirit, and to strengthen our hearts by Your Word, that our enemy may not prevail over us, but that we may ever more abide in Your grace, and be preserved unto everlasting life through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
C: God most glorious, you who are righteous, come to us with your gracious love. We praise your name because of your love unto us through the pain suffered by your Son Jesus Christ even unto death for us. We implore you to be with us as we remember the suffering of our savior on our behalf. O Jesus Christ, visit us with encouragement from above when we are tempted so that we will not lose our faith because of the love of money and earthly things like Judas Iscariot who betrayed you because of love of money. Let us be encouraged by the suffering and death you experienced to redeem mankind. Fill us with love to faithfully follow you as your faithful disciples who love you sincerely and truly up to the time you will come with your angels to rapture us righteous Father, world without end. Amen
Second Sunday in Lent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, grant us we implore You by Your Holy Spirit, that He may strengthen our hearts and confirm our faith and hope in Your grace and mercy, so that although we have reason to fear because of our conscience, our sin, and our unworthiness, we may nevertheless, with the woman of Canaan, hold fast to Your grace, and in every trial and temptation find You a very present help and refuge, through Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O Lord our God in heaven, you who do remember us through your grace and love, do not let our enemies triumph over us, rather help us for we depend only on you where our help come from. Do not leave us to go into slumber in our faith. If we do, wake us up and strengthen us to withstand Satan. Help us to be always watchful through prayer and perseverance. That way we will gain victory and power in life in this world through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Third Sunday in Lent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who has sent Your Son our Lord Jesus Christ to take upon Himself our flesh, that He might destroy the works of the devil and defend us poor sinners against his power: We give thanks unto You for Your merciful help and we implore You to attend us with Your grace in all temptations, to preserve us from carnal security, and by Your Holy Spirit keep us in Your Word and Your fear, that unto the end we may be delivered from the enemy, and obtain eternal salvation, through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God our heavenly Father, we are grateful to you for the gift of your holy Gospel to us where we read the account of your suffering in order to redeem us. Help us not to disgrace you in our acts, but let us be encouraged to bear our cross when trouble and persecution come our way as we preach your gospel in the world. Help us to bear in mind that your apostles suffered same, leaving us a good example to follow. We implore you to help us because of our weakness and frailty, enable us to stand firm in following your footsteps and to live with you in your kingdom. And at the end be ever blessed through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
Fourth Sunday in Lent

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who by Your Son fed five thousand men in the desert with five loaves and two fishes: We implore you to abide graciously also with us in the fullness of your blessing. Preserve us from avarice and the cares of this life, which we may seek first your kingdom and your righteousness, through Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty Father, maker of heaven and earth, you who revealed your power through your creation. Cause us to be obedient to you and to glorify you. You, who through your Son Jesus Christ did reveal yourself also to us, forgive us our sins; make us whole again through your grace. We implore you to help us not to deny knowing you in suffering or persecution, but to proclaim you to all people. Encourage us to stand firm in your way through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
The Annunciation Sunday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty God, Who of Your great mercy caused Your Son to be conceived by the Holy Spirit and to be born of the blessed Virgin Mary according to the angel s annunciation: Grant us by Your grace, that we who were conceived and born in sin, but have been born again of water and the Holy Spirit, may as Your children lead a holy life, and at last obtain eternal salvation through Your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord our God and heavenly Father, you who through your abundant grace and mercy did send us your only begotten Son who was conceived by the Holy Spirit and was born by the Virgin Mary. We implore you to graciously cause us to grow in holy living as your children though we were born in sin. At the end be ever blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Palm Sunday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, Who has sent Your Son, our Savior Jesus Christ to take upon Him our flesh, and to suffer death upon the cross that all mankind should follow the example of His great humility: Mercifully grant that we may both follow the example of His patience, and also be made partakers of His resurrection; through the same Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, ever one God world without end. Amen.
C: O God our heavenly Father, we thank you for letting your Son Jesus Christ to come to this world to prepare the way for our salvation. We implore you to allow your Holy Spirit lead us to open our hearts so that Jesus Christ will enter and become our savior. Help us to become your everlasting children through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one ever true God world without end. Amen.
Maundy (Holy) Thursday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Lord Jesus Christ, we thank you that of your infinite mercy you have instituted this Your Sacrament in which we eat Your Body and drink. Your Blood: Grant us, we implore You by Your Holy Spirit that we may not receive this gift unworthily, but that we may confess our sins, remember Your agony and death, believe the forgiveness of sin, and day by day grow in faith and love until we obtain eternal salvation through You Who lives and reigns with the Father and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Loving heavenly Father, we thank you for your love for the world. Through this love you left us something to remember you with in the Sacraments for the wok of our salvation which you have wrought. We thank you for through your Holy Communion you have demonstrated the reality of your kingdom whereby you humbled yourself in washing the feet of your disciples setting us an example of love as we fellowship at your table in the supper. Help us imitate you that people will know we are your disciples through brotherly love that binds us in your Supper. Lord Jesus Christ, you who instituted this Supper to be a spiritual food to us. Let this bread that we eat grant us the Holy Spirit that will cleanse our hearts. Likewise the Cup we drink grants us the forgiveness of our sins. Let your presence in this Sacrament be real to us by faith through the power of the Holy Spirit. We ask that you give us your enabling grace to be in your kingdom and fellowship with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Good Friday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, Who has willed that Your Son should bear for us the pains of the cross, that you might remove from us the power of the adversary. Help us to remember and give thanks for our Lord s passion that we may receive the remission of sin and redemption from everlasting death, through the same our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
C: God our everlasting Father, most merciful. You who did allow your Son Jesus Christ to come into this world and bore our sins on the cross; Keep our hearts fixed on him through faith, not to be afraid of our adversaries. Father God, thank you for your love to us in Jesus Christ. We bow under your cross that we were to carry but you made it yours. Though we are stained with sin, we come before you to cleanse and make us yours. We acknowledge our shortcoming that separates us from you; correct us through your Holy Spirit. Bring us to the realization of our sins and shortcoming, to repent and be reconciled to you. Help us to forgive those who offend us. Give us strength and endurance when we are in trouble. When we go astray, bring us back to your caring hands. Make us yours by your gracious work for us on the cross; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who delivered You Son for our offenses, and raised Him again for our justification: We implore You, grant us Your Holy Spirit that He may rule and govern us according to Your will; graciously keep us in the true faith; defend us from all sins, and after this life raise us unto eternal life, through the same Your beloved Son Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord our God, Almighty Father, thank you for by the resurrection of Jesus from the dead we are reborn. We implore you to help us through your Holy Spirit to believe his resurrection from the dead is victory over the power of Satan and death. Give us faith that we may know that on the last day we will live with him in his kingdom through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God world without end. Amen.
First Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you that of your ineffable grace, for the sake of Your Son, You have given us the holy Sacraments, that through the same we may have comfort and forgiveness of sin. We implore you, grant us Your Holy Spirit that we may establish our faith until we at last obtain salvation through Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you because the death and resurrection of Jesus Christ brought light to the world. We implore you to help us through your Holy Spirit to walk with him to brighten our path through that we will be light to the world and people will come to have this light and salvation through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Second Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who of Your fatherly goodness have been mindful of us poor miserable sinners and have given Your beloved Son to be our shepherd, not only to nourish us by His Word, but also to defend us from sin, death, and the devil: We implore You, grant us Your Holy Spirit that even as this Shepherd do know us and succor us in every affliction, we also may know Him, and trusting in Him, seek help and comfort in Him, from our hearts obey His voice, and obtain eternal salvation, through the same Your Son Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for your Son Jesus Christ who came and became the good shepherd and gave his life on the cross for his sheep. We implore you to give us your Holy Spirit to guide us, to hear his voice and to always follow him who is our good shepherd and savior Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Third Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who of Your fatherly goodness suffer Your children to come under Your chastening rod here on earth, that we may be like unto Your only begotten Son in suffering and hereafter in glory: We implore You comfort us in temptations and afflictions by Your Holy Spirit, that we may not fall into despair, but that we may continually trust in Your Son s promise, that our trials will endure but a little while, and will then be followed by eternal joy; that we thus in patient hope may overcome all evil, and at last obtain eternal salvation, through the same Your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our Lord Jesus Christ Son of the Almighty God; in times of trouble and persecution we retrieve and even forget you. Because of human nature, we seek consolation and encouragement where there is no consolation and salvation. We ask you to strengthen us so that we will not deny this faith we have received or through worldly deceit abandon the faith you have called us into; always help us to be comforted by your word and the power of the Holy Spirit to remain in the gospel promise of your salvation through Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Fourth Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who through Your Son did promise us Your Holy Spirit, that He should convince the world of sin, of righteousness, and of judgment: We implore You, enlighten our hearts that we may confess our sins, through faith in Christ obtain everlasting righteousness, and in all our trials and temptations retain this consolation that Christ is Lord over the devil and death, and all things, and that He will graciously deliver us out of all our afflictions, and make us forever partakers of eternal salvation, through the same Your Son Jesus Christ, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God Almighty, we thank you because when we pray you do hear us. Incline your ear to us and answer us. Be merciful to us for you are kind. Hearken unto our petitions. Lord God cause a change in our behavior so we can love one another and be united in all our deeds that glorify your name. Help us to understand each other. Let not selfishness hinder us from truly loving others with the kind of love you called us with. God we are yours; we plead, may your spirit fill our hearts to let us understand we belong to you. If we belong to you, we will always love as your nature is to love. Let this love be like fountain of ever flowing water. Thank you for you always hears us. These we ask in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Fifth Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who through Your Son did promise us that whatsoever we ask in His name You will give us. We implore You, keep us in Your Word, and grant us Your Holy Spirit that He may govern us according to Your will, protect us from the power of the devil, from false doctrine and worship; also defend our lives against all danger; grant us Your blessing and peace that we may in all things perceive Your merciful help, and both now and forever praise and glorify You as our gracious Father, through our Lord Jesus Christ Your Son, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, thank you for loving the world that you gave your Son to come and die and rose to give us life everlasting. We ask that you strengthen us so that we too will love one another, through this, the world will believe that we are your children and will receive your word which you gave us through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Ascension Day

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
LORD Jesus Christ, Almighty Son of God art no longer in humiliation here on earth, but seated at the right hand of Your Father, Lord over all things. We implore You, send us Your Holy Spirit, give Your Church pious pastors, preserve Your Word, control and restrain the devil and all who would oppress us; mightily uphold Your Kingdom, until all Your enemies shall have been put under Your feet, that we may hold the victory over sin, death, and the devil, through You, Who lives and reigns with God the Father and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God Almighty, open our minds to understand the meaning of your plan for our salvation. Help us understand the prophecies of the Old Testament prophets about you. We can not comprehend your will unless you help us; open our minds and hearts to accept our sins and repent of them. Send us your spirit to enable us be your faithful witnesses in our homes, among our relations, our tribesmen and our nation. We implore you to accept our petitions in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Sixth Sunday after Easter

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we give thanks to You that through Your Holy Spirit has appointed us to bear witness of Your dear Son. Jesus Christ our Lord. We implore You, inasmuch as the world cannot endure such testimony, and persecutes us in every way, grant us courage and comfort, that we may not be offended because of the cross, but continue steadfastly in Your testimony, and be found always among those who know You and Your Son, until we obtain eternal salvation through the same Your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, we glory and honor belongs to you forever and ever. We implore you to give us the Holy Spirit to see the glory of Jesus Christ in us. Help us to stand firm in our belief and faith in you. Let ignorance and selfishness not make us afraid of telling the truth so that instead of preaching the gospel we end up condemning and judging people. Help us present the love of Christ to them. These we ask with thanks in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Pentecost Day

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Lord Jesus Christ Almighty Son of God, we thank You that You have established Your Church on earth and have called us unto holiness: We implore You, send Your Holy Spirit into our hearts through Your will, comfort us in every temptation and misfortune, and defend us by Your truth against every error so that we may continue steadfast in the faith, increase in love and all good works, and firmly trusting in Your grace, which through death You have purchased for us, obtain eternal salvation You Who reigns with the Father and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God, we thank you for giving us different tongues; through your word we are able to understand each other. We thank you because through this there will be no tongue in which the gospel will not be preached. We saw how on the Pentecost day where the the gospel was preached to people from different countries and tongues and there after, people continued to preach the gospel in their tongues. Fill us with your Holy Spirit so that we can comprehend and understand your word and what it means today. That we will understand your will; you who lives and reigns with the Father; one in three; world without end. Amen.
Trinity Sunday

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Lord God our heavenly Father. We poor sinners confess that in our flesh dwells no good thing, and that left to ourselves, we die and perish in sin, since that which is born of the flesh is flesh and cannot see the kingdom of God. but we implore You: Grant us Your grace and mercy, and for the sake of Your Son Jesus Christ, send Your Holy Spirit into our hearts, that being regenerate, we may firmly believe the forgiveness of sins, according to Your promise in baptism; and that we may daily increase in brotherly love, and in other good works, until we at last obtain eternal salvation, through the same Your beloved Son, Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for our new birth by your mercy through our baptism by the Holy Spirit and the forgiveness of sins. Help us to always be one with you through the grace of our baptism. We implore you through the Holy Spirit help us to be meek before people as we remember the forgiveness of our sins each day by faith through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
First Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we implore You to rule and govern our hearts by Your Holy Spirit, that we may not like the rich man hear Your Word in vain and become so devoted to things temporal as to forget things eternal, but that we readily and according to our ability minister to such as are in need and not defile ourselves with surfeiting and pride, trial and misfortune, keep us from despair and grant us to put our trust wholly in Your Fatherly help and grace, so that in faith and Christian patience we may overcome all things, through Your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you for not considering your heavenly glory, you left your honor and came down to the world and embraced us in your kingdom. We implore you to help us receive your word whole heartedly, and to proclaim your name without fear; to help the hungry and the needy both physically and spiritually. Let us not be over taken by the desires of the world, but to keep our hope and faith in your Son Jesus Christ our savior, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Second Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we give thanks to You that through Your holy Word You have called us to Your great Supper, and we implore You: Quicken our hearts by Your Holy Spirit that we may not hear Your Word without fruit, but that we may prepare ourselves rightly for Your kingdom and not suffer ourselves to be hindered by any worldly care, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, thank you for sending the Holy Spirit our helper and guide in all things. We implore you to remove murmuring and excuses that prevent us from proclaiming your gospel. Help us keep our hope in your Son Jesus Christ who watches over us in our life journey and deeds. Help our hearts not to have any reason for falling because of worldly cravings, but to always depend on your grace and mercy. Finally to be gathered with you in the place you have prepared for all believers, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Third Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father; we all like sheep have gone astray, having suffered ourselves to be led away from the right path by Satan and our own sinful flesh. We implore You graciously, to forgive us all our sins for the sake of Your Son Jesus Christ, and quicken our hearts by Your Holy Spirit, that we may abide in Your Word, and in true repentance and a steadfast faith continue in Your Church unto the end, and obtain eternal salvation, through our Lord Jesus Christ Your Son, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, we ask you to keep our faith in you. Just as you called Matthew at the tax collector s office who in the eyes of the Jews was a sinner, but through your love and grace you called him and even fellowshipped with him. We thank you for not looking down on sinners but have called us to proclaim your gospel of salvation of sinners. At the end be ever blessed through your only begotten Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Fourth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, Who art merciful, and through Christ did promise us that You will neither judge nor condemn us, but graciously forgive our sins, and abundantly provide for all our wants of body and soul: We pray You that by Your Holy Spirit, Your will establish in our hearts a confident faith in Your mercy and teach us also to be merciful to our neighbors, that we may not judge or condemn others, but willingly forgive all men, and judging only ourselves, lead blessed lives in Your fear, through Your dear Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end.
C: O God our heavenly Father, all thanks, praise and honor belong to you. You are from eternity our God; you never change. You watch over us giving us strength and guidance through the Holy Spirit. Help us to be sorrowful of our evil deeds that go contrary to your will so that we will come back to you. We implore you to teach us to know why you suffered even to the cross in order to redeem us. Through this we too may offer ourselves for the sake of your name as your witness to the world. At the end to be ever blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Fifth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Jesus Christ Son of the living God who have given us your Holy Word, and have bountifully provided for all our temporal wants, we confess that we are unworthy of all these mercies, and that we have rather deserved punishment: but we implore you, forgive us our sins, and prosper and bless us in our several calling that by your strength we may be sustained and defended, now and forever, and so praise and glorify you eternally, you who lives and reigns with the Father and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our heavenly Father, help us love one another to allow the Holy Spirit control our hearts so that Satan will not take our hearts captive. Help us to shun the works of the flesh and all its desires. Help us to put on the fruit of the spirit that is love and to live in it. We implore you to help preachers of your gospel in the world; protect them body and soul as you did to Prophet Elijah. Encourage us to do your work faithfully. Help us to always be focused on you so that we will not turn back, but to always look at the face of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Sixth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we confess that we are poor, wretched sinners, and that there is no good in us, our hearts, flesh and blood being so corrupted by sin, that we never in this life can be without sinful lusts and desires; therefore we implore you dear Father, forgive us these sins and let your Holy Spirit cleanse our hearts that we may desire and love your word, abide by it, and thus by your grace by forever saved; through our Lord Jesus Christ your Son, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, we thank you for sending us as sheep among wolves and have given us power to give peace to those in difficulties and to bring them meekly to you. Help us to be humble, bearing each others burden in that way we will fulfill your will. We implore you to help us and weigh our hearts and bring us back to the path of righteousness. For through your grace we saw in spirit so as to reap everlasting life in you. Help us continue in this manner till the coming of your Son Jesus Christ to judge the world to find us worthy faithful servants. These we ask through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives, and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Seventh Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, who in the wilderness did by your Son abundantly, feed four thousand men besides women and children with seven loaves and a few small fishes. We implore you, graciously abide among us with your blessing and keep us from covetousness and the cares of this life, that we may seek first your kingdom and your righteousness, and in all things needful for body and soul, experience your ever- present help; through your Son Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, everlasting Father, you are our God yesterday, today and forever. We implore you to fill us with your love as this Samaritan who through compassion and pity took the burden of saving the man who fell among armed robbers. Give us loving hearts towards our neighbors when they are in trouble; to show them mercy because of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God world without end. Amen.
Eighth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we most heartily thank You that You have caused us to come to the knowledge of your word. We pray you; graciously keep us steadfast in this knowledge unto death that we may obtain eternal life, send us now and ever pious pastors, who faithfully preach your word without offense or false doctrine, and grant them long life. Defend us from all false teachings and frustrate the counsels of all those who pervert your word, who come to us in sheep s clothing, but are inwardly ravening wolves, that your true church may evermore be established among us, and be defended and preserved from such false teachers, through Jesus Christ your Son, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty and holy God, we ask you to help us pay attention to your word; to serve you in ways that your name will be honored and glorified just as Mary listened to your word. Help us to always read your word, to pray and to unite with other believers because of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Ninth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, who have bountifully given us your blessing and our daily bread: We implore You, preserve us from covetousness, and so quicken our hearts that we willingly share your blessed gifts with our needy brethren, that we may be found faithful stewards of your gifts, and abide in your grace when we shall be removed from our stewardship, and shall come before your judgment through our Lord Jesus Christ your Son, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God our Father in heaven, we thank you for your holy Scripture. We implore you to help us not to fall into temptation or trap of worldly desires; rather let us depend on you because you are our shield and fortress. You will also guard our coming in and our going out because of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Tenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who by your Holy Spirit have revealed unto us the gospel of your Son Jesus Christ; We implore You to quicken our hearts that we may sincerely receive your word and not make light of it, or hear it without fruit, as did your people, the unbelieving Jews, but that we may fear You and daily grow in faith in your mercy and finally obtain eternal salvation, through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O God, most merciful and loving Father, the comforter of those who need comfort and those who seek your face for mercy. As you helped this barren Shunamite woman by giving her a child, likewise we thank you today for sending your Son Jesus Christ who died for our sins and also comforted us and gave us eternal life. Help us to shun anything that will lure us into sin, but to depend on our faith in Jesus. Help us not to serve God and mammon, but to wholly serve you our God alone, maker of everything through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Eleventh Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we implore You to guide and direct us by your Holy Spirit, that we may not forget our sins and be filled with pride, but continue in daily repentance and renewal, seeking our comfort only in the blessed knowledge that You will be merciful unto us, forgive us our sins and grant us eternal life; through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You, and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God, Almighty and everlasting Father, we thank you for your bountiful grace and mercy unto us. We implore you to help us fight the evil desires of this world and to confess our sins before you so that you will forgive us. Help us to guard ourselves from the sin of judging others as the Pharisees did to this woman. Let us mortify ourselves to sin so that it will not rule over our mortal bodies, causing us to go after the desires of the flesh. That way we may be saved through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen
Twelfth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who have created all things: We thank You that You have giving us sound bodies, and have graciously preserved our tongues and other members from the power of the adversary: We implore You, grant us your grace that we may rightly use our ears and tongues, help us to hear your word diligently and devoutly, and with our tongues so to praise and magnify your grace, that no one shall be offended by our words, but that all may be edified thereby, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, we have sinned against you and deserved to be punished, but because of your grace and love, you saved us from eternal death. We implore you to help us serve you with the whole of our hearts not to pay you lip service only while our hearts are far from you. Uphold us through your Son Jesus Christ to faithfully commit ourselves to you. Help us not to be blind guides, but open our hearts to see well so that we will know our short coming and sinfulness before you and ask you for forgiveness. Help us to lead others in righteousness through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen
Thirteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we most heartily thank You that You have granted us to live in this accepted time, when we may hear your holy Gospel, know your fatherly will, and behold your Son Jesus Christ. We pray You most merciful Father, let the light of your holy Word remain with us, and so govern our hearts by your Holy Spirit, that we may never forsake your word, remain steadfast in it, and finally obtain eternal salvation, through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God, our heavenly Father, we whole heartedly thank you because of the gift of your Son Jesus Christ for our sins. We implore you to keep us in this faith; strengthen us to do your will, for you said, if we do what you command us we will be your children who will inherit your kingdom. Help us to live in this your promise so that we will bear children that will last and to shine as light through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Fourteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, who by your blessed word and your holy baptism have mercifully cleansed all who believe from the fearful leprosy of sin (as you did cleansed the cripple woman), and daily do grant us your gracious help in all our need. We implore You to enlighten our hearts by your Holy Spirit, that we may never forget these your blessings, but ever live in your fear, and trusting fully in your grace with thankful hearts continually praise and glorify You, through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, the great physician. We thank you because it is only in you we can have healing and forgiveness of sins. We implore you to heal us from the disease of sin that weigh us down making us captives under the power of Satan like this woman who spent eighteen years held captive under the power of Satan. Here we are before you so that you can lose and free us from the spirit of infirmity that kept us captive so that we can be freed and grow in you through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen
Fifteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You for all your benefits that You have given us life and graciously sustained us unto this day. We implore You, take not your blessing from us, preserve us from covetousness, that we may serve You only, love and abide in You, and not defile ourselves by idolatrous love of mammon, but hope and trust only in your grace, through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our heavenly Father, we thank you for not hiding the secret of life from us. We ask you to help us how to treasure for eternal life not for this earthly life where moths and rust and robbers will part us with. Help us to know that the best treasure for our wealth is giving you our life and wealth for the propagation of your gospel. This is most honorable and blessed for our souls. We implore you to help us depend on you always through the power of the Holy Spirit who will enlighten us to walk seeking your heavenly kingdom through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Sixteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, who did sent your Son to be made flesh, that by His death He might atone for our sins and deliver us from eternal death. We pray You, confirm in our hearts the hope that our Lord Jesus Christ, who with but a word raised the widow s son, in like manner will raise us on the last day, and grant us eternal life; through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father, Almighty and eternal; the most merciful and loving. We thank you for you are God who hears our petitions. Through prayers and faith, all our needs whenever we bring them to you, you do answer us. We implore you to heal us from the disease of sin and cares of this world so that we will carry on as you healed this woman with the flow of blood and Jairus daughter whom you raised from the dead through their faith. These all we ask through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Seventeenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father; we implore You to guide and direct us by your Holy Spirit, that we may not exalt ourselves, but humbly fear You with our whole heart and keep your word, and hallow the Lord s day, that we may also be hallowed by your word. Help us, first to place our hope and confidence in your Son Jesus Christ, who alone is our righteousness and Redeemer, and then amend and better our lives in accordance with your word, that we may avoid all offenses and finally obtain eternal salvation, through your grace in Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God maker of heaven and earth and everything in it. We thank you for coming to free us from the power of the law. We implore you to help us in all our days here on earth; protect us from committing evil and fill us with compassion, obedience and faithfulness. At the end that we may inherit your kingdom through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Eighteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we are poor miserable sinners, we know your will, but cannot fulfill it because of the weakness of our flesh and blood, and because our enemy the devil, will not leave us in peace. Therefore, we pray You, shed your Holy Spirit in our hearts, that in steadfast faith, we may cling to your Son Jesus Christ, find comfort in His passion and death believe the forgiveness of sin through Him, and in willing obedience of your will lead holy lives on earth, until by your grace, through a blessed death we depart from this world of sorrow and obtain eternal life, through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our heavenly Father, we thank you for sending your Son Jesus Christ. We ask you to help us do your will by which you called us to be your children through Jesus Christ. Help us to shun all self centeredness through the proclamation of your word; let our testimony be targeted towards honoring your name. Help us to seek your ways alone so that our land will be blessed all the days of our life. Turn our hearts towards you and to desist from pursuing the things of the world that separates us from you so that we may not perish. But through your grace let us choose life and stick to it that we and our descendants may live in your kingdom through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Nineteenth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who by your Son Jesus Christ, did mercifully help the palsied man both in body and soul. We implore You for the sake of your great mercy. Be gracious also unto us, forgive us all our sins, and so govern us by your Holy Spirit, that we may not ourselves be the cause of sickness and other afflictions, keep us in your fear and strengthen us by your grace, that we may escape temporal and eternal wrath and punishment, through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God our Father, we thank you for you are the light of the world and your light shines everywhere. We implore you to open our eyes so that we will see clearly like this blind man who received his sight. We are blind spiritually through sin and ignorance of your word which is a light to our feet. Open our eyes to see our shortcoming, to proclaim your word without fear. Destroy our bodily members that crave after the desires of this world. Remove from us lying to one another and cause us to put on the new man who will renew us according to your will through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Twentieth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father; we thank You, that of your great mercy You have called us by your Holy Word to the blessed marriage feast of your Son, and through Him do forgive us all our sins; but being daily beset by temptation, offense, and danger and being weak in ourselves and given to sin, we implore you graciously to protect us by Your Holy Spirit, that we fall not, and if we fall and defile our wedding- garment, with which your Son have clothed us, graciously help us again and lead us to repentance, that we fall not forever, preserve in us a constant faith in your grace through our Lord Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Almighty God, we thank you for calling us to serve you in your vineyard in this world. We implore you to give us good character that we may be good stewards who will tend your vineyard. Help us not to be like these stewards who maltreated those sent by the landowner to gather in the produce of his farm. Help us not to be found maltreating your workers by not following your will. Rather than doing what will bring dishonor to your name, help us to respect the pouring of the blood of your Son Jesus Christ that was poured for our sins on the cross so that we may work faithfully in your vineyard. These we ask through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty- First Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who by your son have promised us the forgiveness of sins, righteousness and everlasting life. We implore You, do by your Holy Spirit quicken our hearts that we in daily prayer may seek our help in Jesus Christ against all temptations, and constantly believing His promise, obtain that for which we pray and at last be saved, through your Son Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Our Father who is in heaven, God Almighty, you who is ready to hear our prayers. We thank you for you are a patient God, slow to anger; you who have no desire in the death of a sinner but that he should repent and forsake his sins. We implore you to help us confess our sins, repent and forsake them so that we will be saved through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
All Saints Day

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who through your only begotten and beloved Son Jesus Christ, will sanctify all your elected and beloved; Give us grace to follow their faith, hope, and charity, that we together with them may obtain eternal life, through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O Lord our God, Almighty Father; we thank you for calling us into your kingdom in this world and the one to come where glory and honors all belong to you. We implore you to lead and help us to listen to your word. Let your Holy Spirit lead us so as to die like the seed of wheat that fell on good ground. That way we will be enabled to live with the Father through Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty- Second Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and eternal God; we confess that we are poor sinners and cannot answer one of a thousand, when You contends with us; but with all our hearts we thank You, that You have taken all our guilt from us and laid it upon your dear Son Jesus Christ, and made Him to atone for it: We pray You graciously to sustain us in faith, and to govern us by your Holy Spirit, that we may live according to your will, in neighborly love, service, and helpfulness, and not give way to wrath or revenge, that we may not incur your wrath, but always find in You a gracious Father, through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O Lord our God, Almighty Father; we thank you for the light of your word in our hearts. We implore you to lead us through your Holy Spirit to seek peace with all men as you have taught us through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty-Third Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You that You have hitherto granted us peace and graciously spared us from war and foreign dominion: We pray You, graciously let us continue to live in your fear according to your will, giving no cause for wars or other punishment, govern and direct our magistrates, that they may not hinder the obedience due to You, but maintain righteousness, that we may enjoy happiness and blessing under their government, through our Lord Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God, Almighty Father; we thank you for your grace and great mercy to us in sending your Son Jesus Christ into the world to save sinners. We implore you to help us receive him in our hearts to be our king and saviour; he who did not consider the kingdom of this world as anything to grasp but emptied himself in order to save us. We ask this through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty-Fourth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty and everlasting God, who by your Son have promised us forgiveness of our sins and deliverance from eternal death, we pray that by your Holy Spirit You will daily increase our faith in your grace through Christ, and establish us in the certain hope that we shall not die, but peacefully sleep, and be raised again on the last day to eternal life and salvation, through our Lord Jesus Christ your Son, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our Father in heaven; you are God eternal and you live today and forever. You alone have the power to raise the dead to eternal life. We implore you to help us through your Holy Spirit to keep this faith and be raised on the resurrection day; to live with you where you went to prepare for us together with angels and all believers; through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty-Fifth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we most heartily thank You that by your Word You have brought us out of the darkness of error into the light of your grace. We implore You, mercifully help us to walk in that light, guard us from all error and false doctrine, and grant that we may not as the Jews, become ungrateful and despise and persecute your Word, but receive it with all our heart, govern our lives according to it, and put all our trust in your grace through the merit of your dear Son our Lord Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: O Lord our God and Father in heaven; we thank you for not hiding anything from us regarding the day of your coming; for you have shown us the signs of your coming. We implore you to help us through the power of your Holy Spirit to be empowered so that the signs of your coming will not make us afraid but to be calm as we await your coming with the hope of getting eternal life through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Twenty- Sixth Sunday after Trinity

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
O Almighty, eternal and merciful God, who by your beloved Son our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, have established the kingdom of grace for us, that we might believe the forgiveness of our sins, in your holy Church on earth, since You are a God who has no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from his way and live: we implore You, graciously forgive us all our sins through the same your Son Jesus Christ, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
C: Lord God our heavenly Father; we thank you for your Son Jesus Christ who came and saved us from sin through setting us in good ways unto eternal life.
