We implore you to help us walk in this faith and so enter through the narrow gate that leads to life. Help us to fulfill the work you gave to each one of us in your vineyard to the end. Let us not be last and the last be the first. We ask these through your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.
Last Sunday of the Church Year

elements.title: A&B
elements.text:
Almighty God, who rules and governs Your Holy Christian Church, we give You most hearty thanks for the plenteous blessings of the Gospel which You have granted unto us during the past year, and we implore You to bestow upon us your Holy Spirit, that by His gracious working we may be made rightly to value your precious means of grace, so that we being turned to You, may come to everlasting life through Jesus Christ Your Dear Son our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit for ever and ever. Amen.
C: Lord God our Father in heaven; we thank you for through your grace you opened the eyes of the apostles to see the glory and honors of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord. We implore you to let your Holy Spirit enlighten people of the world who do not know you yet; to receive the testimony of your Church, that Jesus Christ is your only begotten Son whom you sent to the world so that whosoever believe in him should not perish but have eternal life. We ask all these in the name of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord; who lives and reigns with you and the Holy Spirit; one ever true God, world without end. Amen.

elements.title: COLLECT S FOR SPECIAL OCCASIONS
elements.text: Lutheran Day (First Sunday in October)

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
O Lord, praise and glory and might and power be ascribed unto You, for ever and ever, we thank You for your loving care to mankind whom You created; who once lived in darkness and the shadow of death, You sent us a Savior through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, through whom we got the light of the Gospel which we this day commemorate. We are thankful for the missionaries you sent who brought this light. We implore you, strengthen your workers through your Holy Spirit, to depend on you in faith, grant that we be watchful, for we know neither the day nor the hour. We pray this in the name of Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
(The Last Prayer)

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Lord God, maker of heaven and earth; who through your Holy Spirit did send one man Dr. Bronnum who came from a distant country thousands of miles away to this our country Nigeria with Your Word. We remember now the day and the benefits we derive by his coming. Your Word which he brought together with your Gospel of redemption helped us how to conduct our lives in this transient world. We implore you, on this day inspire your followers in this country how we should follow Jesus example who left His glory in heaven, came down to save us from our sins, Dr. Bronnum and his colleagues left everything for the sake of your gospel. Grant us the will power to fulfill your command which enjoins us thus, Go therefore . In the name of your Son Jesus Christ our Lord, we pray this. Amen.
The Reformation Day

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Most merciful God, Almighty, protector of your Holy Church; we pray You to graciously accept our thanks for the restoration of your Gospel and we implore You ever more to defend your church from all error, and to preserve it in the purity of Your Word, and so rule and direct our hearts by your Holy Spirit, that we may ever continue steadfast in the faith of our Lord and Savior, Who alone is our righteousness and wisdom, our consolation and peace, and finally be brought to behold your glory; through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit for ever and ever. Amen.
The Festival of Harvest

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Almighty God, most merciful Father, Who opened your hand, and satisfied the desires of every living thing: We give You most humble and hearty thanks that You have crowned the fields with your blessing, and have permitted us once more to gather in the fruits of the earth: and we implore You to bless and protect the living seed of Your Word sown in our hearts, that in the plenteous fruits of righteousness we may always present to You an acceptable thanks offering; through Jesus Christ your Son our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, ever one true God, world without end. Amen.

The Epiphany day is the 6th of January, when it falls on ordinary day, we do not gather for worship, except on Sunday. On both Maundy Thursday and Ascension Day, we do gather for worship in the evening around 4 pm, and we follow the order of Sunday Service. On Good Friday we do gather for worship in the morning as we use to come for Sunday morning worship. All Saints Day is the first Sunday in November. October 31st is Reformation Day, and may fall on any other day other than Sunday. When it is not on Sunday, we should assemble for worship in the evening using the order of Sunday service.
The Sacrament of Holy Baptism
The minister shall say: Beloved in the Lord, let us rise as we affirm the creed of our Christian faith with those who seek the Sacrament of Holy Baptism (The creed shall be recited)
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, Who according to His abundant mercy have begotten us again unto a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You that through your only-begotten Son You have instituted Holy Baptism, in which You adopted us as your children, and gave us your Holy Spirit, the forgiveness of our sins, and life everlasting. We implore You graciously to receive this person who presents himself/ herself (these persons who present themselves) before You; admit him (her, them) into your holy church; and keep him (her, them) now and forever in your blessed communion. Amen.
(In case of adults, or adults together with infants, this prayer shall end here, but when it is only infants, the prayer shall end here, but when it is only infants, the prayer shall
continue thus:)
We implore You, receive this child (these children) we present before You mercifully. Admit him (her, them) into your true church; and keep him (her, them) in your blessed communion in life and death. Amen.

elements.title: Thus says our Lord Jesus Christ
elements.text:
All authority in heaven and on earth has been given to Me. Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit; teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you; and behold, I am with you always, even unto the end of the world.
(In case of infant baptism, the following shall be said)

elements.title: And concerning the little children Jesus said
elements.text:
Suffer the little children to come unto Me, do not forbid them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God. Truly I say to you, whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, shall in no wise enter therein. And He took them in his arms and blessed them, laying his hands upon them.
Let us therefore help this child (these children) to obtain His blessing by baptizing him (her, them) into the name of the triune God.
Receive the sign of the holy cross upon your forehead and upon your breast as a token that you believe in and belong to the crucified Lord Jesus Christ.
(In case of infant baptism, the pastor shall address the parent saying, I
now ask and you shall answer for this child:)
-name- Do you renounce the devil and all his works and all his ways?
Answer: Yes, I renounce
Do you believe in God the Father Almighty, maker of heaven and earth?
Answer: Yes, I believe
Do you believe in Jesus Christ His only Son our Lord, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, Born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, dead and buried, descended into hell; The third day rose again from the dead; Ascended into heaven, and seated at the right hand of God the Father Almighty, from there He shall come to judge the living and the dead?
Answer: Yes, I believe
Do you believe in the Holy Spirit, the Holy Christian Church, the Communion of Saints; the forgiveness of sins; the Resurrection of the body; And the life everlasting?
Answer; Yes I believe
Will you want to be baptized into this Christian faith?
Answer: Yes I will
-name- I baptize you into the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
(The Pastor lays his/her hand on the candidate and shall say:)
Almighty God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has now begotten you by water and the Holy Spirit, and has forgiven you all your sins, strengthen you with His grace unto life everlasting. The Lord preserve your going out and your coming in, from this time forth and forevermore. Amen.
Peace by unto you. Amen.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Our Father, who art in heaven; Hallowed be your Name; your kingdom come; your will be done on earth as it is in heaven; Give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us; and lead us not into temptation, But deliver us from evil; for yours is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
(Charge to sponsors and parents)
Dear Christian friends who are sponsors for this child (these Christian), you are to be witnesses that he (she, they have) has received the true Christian Baptism in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. You are also to remember your duty toward this child (these children) whose sponsors you are. If the parents die before he (she, they arrive) arrives at the age of discretion, you shall as far as possible, see that he (she, they are) is instructed in the principles of the Christian faith, in order that he (she, they) may continue with Christ even as he (she, they) now through baptism has (have) been grafted into Him.
And you parents, who have brought your child (children) to the baptismal font, shall bear in mind the obligation taken upon yourselves, that you instruct him (her, them) in the principles of the Christian faith, and that you are to be living witnesses to the faith into which he (she, they have) has been baptized. May God so help you and grant you His blessing.
Peace be with you Amen.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text: Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank you with all our hearts that you have admitted us unto Holy Baptism, in which for the sake of your Son, You have granted us the forgiveness of all our sins, and the life everlasting. We implore You: preserve us in the faith, lest we fall into doubt concerning your holy gifts; strengthen us by your Holy Spirit in our struggle against sin, that we may continue in the grace of our Baptism until we at last obtain eternal salvation through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.

elements.title: Benediction
elements.text:
P:	The Lord be with you
C:	And with your Spirit
P:	The Lord bless you and keep you.
The Lord make His face shine upon you and be gracious unto you.
The Lord lift up His countenance upon you and give you peace. Amen.
The Confirmation Service
(Reciting the Creed)
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who according to His abundant mercy have begotten us again unto a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.
Beloved in the Lord, you see present here who in Holy Baptism was/were received by our Lord Jesus Christ and made members of His Church. He (she, they) desire publicly to confess his (her, their) Christian faith and to be established in his (her, their) baptismal covenant.
While he (she, they were) was an infant (infants), he was (she was, they were) grafted into the kingdom of God through Holy Baptism, in accordance with our Lord s command, saying:
Go therefore and make disciples of all the nations, baptizing them into the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit; teaching them to observe all things whatsoever I have commanded you, and behold, I am with you always even unto the end of the world
Also: suffer the little children to come unto me, do not forbid them, for to such belongs the kingdom of God
Now he (she, they have) has been instructed to observe all that the Lord has Commanded the Church, and desire to make public affirmation of his (her, their) Baptism.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Almighty and most merciful God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who did receive children into your kingdom. We implore You by your Holy Spirit so to bless and govern this (these) your servant(s) brought to You in Holy Baptism, that he (she, they) may truly confess Your Name, be living members of your church, and in true faith and obedience to your gospel, continue steadfast in the covenant of your grace unto the end, Lord quicken this faith in his (her, their hearts) heart through your Holy Spirit to enable him (her, them) humbly and sincerely confess the same before You and this congregation, through Jesus Christ your Son our Lord Amen.
-Name Do you renounce the devil, and all his works and all his ways?
Answer: Yes I renounce
Do you believe in God the Father Almighty, Maker of heaven and earth?
Answer: Yes I believe
Do you believe in Jesus Christ His only Son our Lord, who was conceived by the Holy Spirit, Born of the virgin Mary; suffered under Pontius Pilate; was crucified, dead and buried, descended into hell: The third day rose again from the dead, Ascended into heaven, And seated at the right hand of God the Father Almighty, from there He shall come to judge the living and the dead?
Answer: Yes I believe
Do you believe in the Holy Spirit, the Holy Christian Church, the Communion of Saints: The forgiveness of sins: The Resurrection of the body; And the life everlasting?
Answer: Yes I believe
(The catechumen shall kneel; the pastor shall lay his/her hand and offer the following prayer :)
May the Almighty God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has adopted you as His child in Holy Baptism, and has made you an heir of eternal life, preserve you in the grace of your Baptism, and may He grant you steadfastness in your faith to the salvation of your soul. Amen.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Our Father, Who art in heaven: Hallowed be your Name: your kingdom come; your will be done on earth as it is in heaven; Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation; but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory for ever and ever. Amen.
Peace be with you. Amen.
(It is appropriate that the minister give each catechumen some written scripture texts).
A hymn may be sung, after which the pastor shall close with prayer.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Almighty and most merciful God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who have graciously permitted us to witness the solemn renewal of the baptismal covenant with you. We heartily implore you to keep us as faithful followers of Jesus Christ, steadfast in the true faith and in obedience to your holy Gospel. Strengthen us by your Holy Spirit, that neither false doctrine, the lusts of the flesh, nor the vanities of the world may lead us astray from the truth. Grant us grace that we may watch and pray, and diligently seek nourishment in your Word and at your Table, so that we may grow in wisdom, holiness and righteousness. May we abide in your Love so that our whole life may be a true confession of your Name, to our own salvation, and to the praise of your Holy Name, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
The Sacrament of Holy Communion

elements.title: Communion hymn after which the minister says:
elements.text:
Grace be unto you and peace from God the Father and our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
Let us hear the testimony of Holy Scripture on the sacrament of Holy Communion in the Gospel of St. John 6:54-56 which says, Whoever eats my flesh and drinks my blood, has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day. For my flesh is real food, and my blood is real drink. Whoever eats my flesh, and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.
Congregation: Praise be to God
Minister: Let us bow our heads and confess our sins before God, that we may not hinder Him from forgiving us our sins.
(Brief silence for reflection and self examination then the minister facing the congregation shall say or sing the sanctus:)
Holy, holy, holy is the Lord God Almighty. Heaven and earth are full of your glory. Hosanna! Hosanna! Hosanna! in the highest! Blessed is He who comes is the name of the Lord. Hosanna in the highest.

elements.title: Congregation
elements.text:
Lamb of God, you take away the sin of the world, have mercy on us
Lamb of God, you take away the sin of the world, have mercy on us
Lamb of God, you take away the sin of the world, grant us your peace. Amen.

elements.title: Minister: Let us pray
elements.text:
Lord, we are not worthy to come into your presence, but without You, we shall all perish. You created the heaven and the earth with your Word, and with this one Word You are able to cleanse us and make us well again. Be merciful unto us not on account of our deeds, but out of your grace and infinite mercy. Do not punish us but forgive us our sins, and dwell within us with the power of your grace, and heal our wounds, that we may have peace of mind through faith in your love and grace. Lead us with your mighty hand in the way of salvation that we may escape death and inherit eternal life. Amen.
(The minister standing faces the congregation saying :)
Minister: God Almighty, in His mercy gave His beloved Son who died for us. He has also forgiven us all our sins. On account of my calling and consecration as a pastor in the church of Christ, based on His authority, I now declare that your sins have been forgiven you, in the Name of the Father, and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
Minister: Beloved friends in Jesus Christ, Our Lord Himself have said, I am the bread of life; He that comes to me shall never hunger, and he that believes in me shall never thirst.
In His Holy supper, the crucified and risen Lord gave Himself to us, so that everyone that hungers and thirsts after righteousness may obtain food and drink unto life everlasting in Him.
Congregation: Praise be unto God.
Minister: Hence, in the obedience of your faith, you shall follow His command when he said, Take, eat and drink all of you; do this in remembrance of me. And He shall unite Himself with you, so that during your sojourn here on earth, you may constantly bear Him in mind, and at last gather unto Him in His kingdom.
Congregation: Thanks be unto God.
Minister: The peace of the Lord be upon you
Congregation: And also with you
Thereafter the Congregation shall share the peace of the Lord with each other, saying: The peace of the Lord be upon you.

elements.title: Minister: Let us Pray for this in Unity
elements.text:
Risen Lord and Saviour, we implore You to be present among us with your abundant love; grant us to receive your Body and Blood in remembrance of you and in confirmation of our faith in the forgiveness of sin. Cleanse us from sin and strengthen us in the inner man, that through faith You may dwell in our hearts. Make us firm in the hope of eternal life; grant us to increase in love, that together with all your believers we may be one in You, even as You and the Father are one. Amen.
Minister: Our Father who art in heaven, Hallowed be your Name; your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread, and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. Lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.

elements.title: Minister
elements.text:
Our Lord Jesus Christ in the night in which He was betrayed took bread,*and when He had given thanks, He broke it and gave it to His disciples saying,
Take, eat, this is my body which is given for you, do this in remembrance of me.
In the same manner, after supper, He took the cup**and when He had given thanks, He gave it to them saying, Drink of it all of you, this cup is the New Covenant in my Blood which is shed for you, and for all people for the forgiveness of sins. Do this as often as you drink, in remembrance of me.
Minister: You may now come to the Lord s Table everything is prepared for you.
Minister: This is the Body of Jesus Christ given for you
This is the Blood of Jesus Christ shed for you
Minister: (When dismissing each group of communicants shall say the following or use the scripture verses below):
Our Lord Jesus Christ, who has now given you His Body and Blood, whereby He has made full satisfaction for all your sins, strengthen and uphold you in true faith unto everlasting life! Peace be with you! Amen.
(Or after each group, the following verses may be used: Matt. 5:2-16, 11:28-30, John 6:48, 51,53,54,55 and 56, 1 John 4:7-21).
Minister: Let us pray
O Lord God, Almighty Father, we thank You that of your great mercy You have refreshed us with these your blessed gifts. We implore You, through the same, to strengthen us, in faith toward You, and in the hope of eternal life, and in fervent love to one another: for the sake of Jesus Christ your beloved Son our Lord. Amen.

elements.title: Benediction
elements.text:
Minister: The Lord be with you
Congregation: And also with you
Minister: The Lord bless you and keep you.
The Lord make His face shine upon you and be gracious unto you.
The Lord lift up His countenance upon you, and give you peace.
Congregation: Amen.
Closing Hymn

elements.title: Closing Prayer .
elements.text:
The Solemnization of Marriage
The Banns of Marriage
When church members request to be wedded, the pastor shall publish the Banns of marriage in the church two or more Sundays before the appointed day for the marriage saying:
-Name and name purpose to enter into the holy estate of matrimony according to God s ordinance. They desire that prayer be made for them that they may enter into this union in the Name of the Lord and be prospered in it. If any one can show just cause why they may not be joined together, let him/her now speak, or else hereafter hold his/her peace. The blessing of God be with them. Amen.
The marriage shall be solemnized in the church. Before solemnizing a marriage, the pastor shall be fully assured that the persons to be married were counseled two or more times and one of which must be in company of their friends. The marriage must be in accordance with God s ordinance and not contrary to God s word.
The Solemnization
Pastor: Who is giving this lady for marriage?
The father or someone entrusted should step forward and say, here I am. Then he shall present the lady to the pastor placing her right hand in the Pastor s who shall in turn place her hand into that of the groom. Thereafter the groom will leave her hand.
Pastor: In the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
Hymn:-
(The bride and groom shall stand in front of the pastor; the friends may stand behind them).
Pastor: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and the communion of the Holy Spirit be with you all.
Congregation: And also with you

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
Lord God our heavenly Father, we thank You for instituting the estate of holy matrimony. We implore You to look in favour upon name and name who enter into wedlock today, blessed them and help them to daily live in your fear and love not to allow any room for anger and discord. Grant them the grace to over come difficult situations in life. Help them to bring up their children in accordance with your will. Grant that we all shall live faithful and obedient lives. And at the end we shall remain blessed through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Pastor: Beloved in Jesus Christ, let us hear what our Lord said in the Holy Scripture on the estate of holy matrimony. The Lord God ordained holy wedlock from the beginning saying, it is not good that man should be alone; I will make him a help meet for him. Of the sanctity and inviolability of this holy estate, our Lord Jesus Christ has said: Have you not read that He who made them from the beginning made them male and female, saying for this reason shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let not man put asunder.
Our Saviour Himself graced with His presence the wedding of Cana and there revealed His glory. Saint Paul spoke of the sacred and mysterious union of Christ and His bride the Church, as the exalted and holy example of the union between a man and his wife. Therefore you shall know that this holy estate is well-pleasing to God and has His blessing.
Pastor: Let us hear what Saint Paul speaking through the Holy Spirit says: Husbands, love your wives just as Christ loved the Church and gave Himself up for her. He who loves his wife loves himself, after all, no one ever hated his own body, but he feeds and cares for it, just as Christ does the church..
In like manner, let us hear what Saint Peter speaking through the Holy Spirit says, wives, in the same way your beauty should not come from outward adornment, such as braided hair and the wearing of gold jewelry and fine clothes. Instead it should be that of your inner self, the unfading beauty of a gentle and a quiet spirit which is of great worth in God s sight. Husbands, in the same way be considerate as you live with your wives and treat them with respect as the weaker partner and as heirs with you of the gracious gifts of life, so that nothing will hinder your prayers.

elements.title: Pastor: Now I ask you
elements.text:
-Name do you take name to be your wedded, wife? If so declare it before God and these witnesses by saying: I do
Answer: Yes I do
Pastor: Will you love her and honour her, and live together with her in prosperity and adversity, whatever God Almighty may allot you? Will you forsake all others, to keep you only unto her, as it is right for a husband to live with his wedded wife, so long as you both shall live?
Answer: Yes I will.

elements.title: Pastor: In like manner I ask you
elements.text:
-Name-do you take-name to be your wedded husband? If so declare before God and these witnesses by saying: I do.
Answer: Yes I do
Pastor: Will you love him and honour him, and live together with him in prosperity and adversity, whatever God Almighty may allot you? Will you forsake all others to keep you only unto him, as it is right for a wife to live with her husband, so long as you both shall live?
Answer: Yes I will.
The ring service may here be administered with the couple facing each other.
Pastor: (The pastor shall receive the ring and deliver same to the groom and bride respectively who should put it on the fourth finger one after the other repeating after the pastor).
The Groom: -name of bride- I take you to be my wedded wife from this day forward to join with you and share all that is to come and I promise to be faithful to you until death parts us. I give you this ring as a sign of my love and faithfulness.
The Bride:- name of groom- I take you to be my wedded husband from this day forward to join with you and share all that is to come and I promise to be faithful to you until death part us. I give you this ring as a sign of my love and faithfulness.
Pastor: Then join your right hands in token thereof. (The pastor shall then place his right hand upon the joined hands of the bridal couple while he/she says):
-name- and-name- forasmuch as you have consented to live together in holy wedlock, and have declared same before God and these witnesses, I pronounce you to be husband and wife before God and man, in the Name of the Father, and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
Pastor: You may now unveil the Bride
Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain those who build it. You who are in the estate of holy matrimony should prove therefore to one anther faithfulness in all things, both in days of prosperity and of adversity, to which God has subjected human life because of sin even in matrimonial estate.
May your daily life be directed by the admonitions of Holy Scriptures, which says, Giving thanks in all things always unto God, the Father, in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ. (Eph. 5:20). In nothing be anxious; but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God, and the peace of God which passes all understanding, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus. Bear one another s burden and so fulfill the law of Christ (Phil. 4:6-7). Put on therefore, as God s elect, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing one another and forgiving one another, even as the Lord forgave you, so also do you; and above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfectness. (Col. 3:12-14)
The bridal couple shall kneel, and the pastor with the laying on of hands shall say:
Our heavenly Father vouchsafe unto- groom and bride- your grace, blessing and prosperity, both to body and soul. Grant that they may love one another faithfully, and serve You sincerely in all things, that they may live as your dear children, and at last be with You in the everlasting habitations.
Our Father, Who art in heaven; Hallowed be your Name, your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven, give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
The Lord be with you or peace be unto you. Amen.
(The bridal rain shall now retire and sit)
Pastor: Exhortation
Signing of Marriage Register/ presentation of Marriage Certificate

elements.title: Offering / Offertory
elements.text:
Hymn
Pastor: (The pastor turns to the Altar for the prayer, saying)

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text: Gracious Father, You bless the family and renew your people Enrich husbands and wives, parents and children more and more with your grace, that strengthening and supporting each other, they may serve those in need and be a sign of the fulfillment of your perfect kingdom, where with Your Son Jesus Christ and the Holy Spirit, You live and reign, one true God, World without end. Amen.

elements.title: Benediction The Lord bless you and keep you.
elements.text:
The Lord make His face shine upon you and be gracious unto you.
The Lord lift up His countenance upon you, and give you peace. Amen.

Genesis 2:18-24 Mark 10:1-10
Psalm 33:5 John 2:1-10
Psalm 112:1 John 15:9-12
Proverbs 31:10-31 Romans 12:1-2
Song of Songs 2:10-13 1Corinthians 12:31-13:13
Song of Songs 8:7 Ephesians 5:21-33
Isaiah 63:7-9 Philippians 4:4-7
John 4:7-12
Marriage Blessing
(The groom and bride shall stand in front of the Altar, then the pastor shall say:)
Pastor: Beloved in Jesus Christ, let us hear what our Lord said in the Holy Scripture on the estate of holy matrimony.
The Lord ordained holy wedlock from the beginning saying, it is not good that man should be alone; I will make him a help meet for him. Of the sanctity and inviolability of this holy estate, our Lord Jesus Christ has said; Have you not read that He who made them from the beginning made them male and female, saying for this reason shall a man leave his father and mother, and shall cleave to his wife and the two shall be one flesh. Therefore what God has joined together, let not man put asunder.
Pastor: Now therefore, I ask you name and your wife- name- do you want the Lord s blessings on your marriage?
Answer: Both of them shall say: Yes I do.
Pastor: Will you love each other, and honour each other, and live together, in prosperity and adversity, whatever God Almighty may allot you, till death do you part?
Answer: Both of them shall say: Yes I will.
Pastor: Then join your right hands in token thereof,
(The pastor shall then place his right hand upon the joined hands of the bridal couple, while he says :)
Forasmuch as you have consented to live together in holy wedlock, and have declared same before God and these witnesses, I testify to you: the Lord s blessing on this your marriage. Amen.
Except the Lord build the house, they labour in vain those who build it. You who are in the estate of holy matrimony should prove therefore to one another faithfulness in all things, both in days of prosperity and of adversity to which God has subjected human life because of sin even in matrimonial estate.
May your daily life be directed by the admonitions of Holy Scripture which says, Giving thanks in all things always unto God the Father in the Name of our Lord Jesus Christ in nothing be anxious, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving, let your requests be made known unto God, and the peace of God which passes all understanding, shall guard your hearts and your thoughts in Christ Jesus. Bear one another s burden and so fulfill the law of Christ. Put on therefore as God s elect, holy and beloved, a heart of compassion, kindness, lowliness, meekness, longsuffering, forbearing one another and forgiving one another, even as the Lord forgave you, so also do you; and above all these things put on love, which is the bond of perfectness.
(The couple shall kneel and the pastor with the laying on of hands shall say :)
Our heavenly father vouchsafe unto this man and his wife your grace, blessing and prosperity, both in body and soul. Grant that they may love one another faithfully, and serve you sincerely in all things, that they may live as your dear children, and at last be with you in the everlasting habitations.
Our Father Who art in heaven, Hallowed be Your Name, your kingdom come, your will be done on earth as it is in heaven, give us this day our daily bread; And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, the power and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
Peace be unto you. Amen.
The Burial of the Dead
In the Church

elements.title: The service shall begin with a Hymn, after which the pastor shall say
elements.text: The Grace of our Lord Jesus Christ and the Peace of God be unto you. Amen.

elements.title: Let us Pray
elements.text:
Lord God Almighty our heavenly Father, Who by the death of your Son has destroyed sin and death, and by His resurrection has restored innocence and everlasting life, in order that we might be delivered from the dominions of the devil and our mortal bodies be raised up from the dead. Grant that with our whole heart we may confidently believe this, and finally with all your Saints share in the joyful resurrection of the just. Through Jesus Christ your beloved Son our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
Beloved in the Lord, let us hear the testimony of Holy Scripture on life and death:
Luke 12:35-37a: Be dressed ready for service and keep your lamps burning, like people waiting for their master to return from a wedding banquet, so that when he comes and knocks, they can immediately open the door for him. It will be good for those servants whose master finds them watching when he comes.
John 8:51 Very truly, I tell you, whoever keeps my word will never see death.
Job 1:21 Naked I came from my mother s womb, and naked shall I return, the Lord gave and the Lord has taken away, blessed be the name of the Lord.
Romans 6:23 For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
John 14:19b. Because I live, you also will live.
(For burial of children, it is advisable to read Mark 10:13-16):- And they brought little children unto Him that He should touch them, and the disciples rebuked them. But when Jesus saw it, He was moved with indignation, and said unto them, suffer the little children come unto me, forbid them not, for of such is the kingdom of God. Truly I say unto you, whosoever shall not receive the kingdom of God as a little child, he shall in no wise enter therein. And He took them in His arms, and blessed them, laying His hands upon them.
(Then a brief exhortation shall follow, then prayer and a hymn after which people will head for the grave yard)
At the Grave

elements.title: Hymn-: After the hymn the minister shall say
Beloved friends let us once again hear from the word of God
elements.text:
John 11:25-26a Jesus said to her, I am the resurrection and the life, he who believes in me even though he dies, will live; and everyone who lives and believes in me will never die.
Revelation 21:3b-4,7 see the dwelling of God is among mortals and He will live with them. They will be his people, and God Himself will be with them and be their God. He will wipe every tear from their eyes. There will be no more death or mourning or crying or pain, for the first things have passed away. He who overcomes will inherit these things, I will be their God, and they will be my children.
1 Corinthians 15:53-57 For this perishable body must put on imperishability, and this mortal body puts on immortality, then the saying that is written will be fulfilled: Death has been swallowed up in victory. O death where is your victory? O death where is your sting? The sting of death is sin, and the power of sin is the law. But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.
(The pastor then moves closer to the grave and says :)
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who according to His abundant mercy has begotten us again unto a living hope by the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead.
(There after the pastor shall throw earth on the coffin three times, while saying).
Out of dust you were taken
Unto dust you shall return
And out of dust you shall rise again

elements.title: Let us Pray
elements.text:
Almighty God, merciful Father, we implore You of your infinite goodness, to strengthen and keep us by your Holy Spirit in the right faith. Give us grace rightly to understand our many transgressions that we may turn to You with all our heart and seek those things which are above, to the end that we may daily die more and more unto sin, live together in brotherly love, serve You in righteousness and true holiness, be prepared through faith in your word for our death, and by your mercy end our days in joyful hope of a blessed resurrection through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
Our Father, who art in heaven; hallowed be your Name, your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.

elements.title: Benediction May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ
elements.text:
The love of God the Father
And the Communion of the Holy Spirit
be and remain with us all. Amen.

elements.title: Hymn
elements.text:
Order for Consecration of a Burial Ground
(It is advisable that the church should set aside a burial ground near the church building which shall be consecrated for the burial of its members).
Church members shall in procession with songs march to the place to be consecrated. As the assembly gather, the pastor shall say:
Pastor: Beloved friends in Christ. Today we are gathered to seek God s blessing and with thanks we shall consecrate this burial ground to His praise. Amen.

elements.title: Hymn
elements.text:
Scripture reading to be followed by an exhortation
Pastor: He who dwells in the shadow of the Most High.
Congregation: Trusts in the shadow of the Almighty.
Pastor: He will surround you with His protection, and you shall find refuge under His wings.
Congregation: His mercy shall be our shield.
Pastor: He shall give Angels your custody in their hands.
Congregation: They will protect you in all your ways.
Consecration of the ground
Pastor: (shall read 1 Cor. 15:19-22, 42-44a,53-57 and then say:-)
I do consecrate this ground for the burial of church members, in the Name of the Father, and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.
Peace be unto those who shall rest here till the great judgment day. Amen.

elements.title: Pastor: Let us all Pray
elements.text:
Lord God the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ hear the supplications which we bring before You now while we consecrate this ground as a resting place for the dead. Take this place under your holy protection unto the day of resurrection.
Almighty and eternal God Who turns, man to destruction and says, Return you children of men, our lives are in your hands. When You call away those whom You have given us, and we lay them here in their graves, strengthen our faith, that we may bless the Name of the Lord, Who gave and Who has also taken away.
Lord Jesus Christ our ever faithful Saviour, Who for our salvation has passed through death and the grave before us, be with us in the hour of death. You who is the resurrection and the life, raise us up to everlasting life.
O Holy Spirit, You blessed Comforter and Advocate with the Father, fill the hearts of those who mourn in this place with your consolation. Draw us heavenward when we look into the open grave, preserve us from spiritual death and eternal condemnation. O holy and most merciful Saviour deliver us not into the bitter pains of eternal death. Grant us grace to attain unto the life which is in Christ, that in Him we be made partakers of the blessed resurrection of the just, through Jesus Christ our Lord. Amen.
Pastor: May the blessings of God the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.
(The following verses of scripture may be used)
Genesis 23:1-20
Romans 6:3-5
1 Thessalonians 4:13-18
John 14:1-6
John 19:38-46
Order for Church Foundation Laying Service

elements.title: Introduction
elements.text:
(This service may be conducted during Sunday worship or on a special day arranged for this purpose)
Church members are to assemble where the foundation is to be laid or in another place, then in procession shall march to the designated place. Before they leave, the pastor or Bishop or Archbishop shall say:
Pastor: Let us go in peace
Congregation: In the name of our Lord
(As the people march, they may sing songs or on arrival at the place a hymn may be sung, then the pastor shall say:
Pastor: Beloved brothers and sisters in Christ. We are gathered here today to seek God s blessing on this foundation laying service.
Let us hear the reading of Holy Scripture from -----------
Exhortation
Pastor: Our help comes from the Lord
Congregation: Who made heaven and earth
Pastor: Blessed be the name of the Lord
Congregation: From now and up to generations to come
Pastor: The stone rejected by builders
Congregation: Has become the corner stone
(The minister may read out the list of items intended to be buried during the foundation laying).
The Creed: To be said by the pastor and the congregation
Pastor: The Lord be with you
Congregation: And also with you

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
Blessed is You our Lord and God King of kings. You who fashioned the heavens as a curtain, Who collected the waters in one place and caused dry land, rocks and high places to come into being. We praise your holy Name, for You are the one who formed us, living stones to be spiritual houses whose chief corner stone is Jesus Christ. Abide with us now and bless us and this foundation which we lay to your glory and honour. Through your Holy Spirit and grace, help us to serve You in body and soul. Receive our praise and thanks through your beloved Son Jesus Christ our Chief Priest. All praise and honour be unto You holy God the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit. We implore You to help us build this building to the glory of your Name through rendering our worship unto You.
Congregation: Amen.
(Now the stone or block prepared as foundation corner stone shall be laid, while the pastor shall say:-)
Pastor: With thanks unto God we lay this stone / block at this corner for the building of a church in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit.
Congregation: Amen.
Pastor: Glory be unto the Name of the Lord, the foundation of this house, established or builds this house.
Congregation: Thanks be unto God. Amen.

elements.title: NOTE
elements.text:
This service shall not be conducted during the Holy Week
The items to be included among things to be buried during foundation laying shall include: names of church elders, Holy Bible, Order of Service Book, Hymnal, list of all members of the congregation as well as that of the building committee.

elements.title: The following scripture verses may be use during this service
elements.text:
Psalm 24 Joshua	4:1-7
Psalm 42 Luke 6:47-49
Psalm 87 1 Corinthians 3:10-14
Psalm 100 Ephesians 2:19-22
Psalm 118 Hebrews 11:8-10
Exodus 3:1-6
Order of Service for the Consecration of a Church

elements.title: As the procession begins the following shall be said
elements.text:
Pastor: Let us go out in peace
Congregation:	In the name of our Lord
Hymn:	Arriving at the church doors, a hymn shall be sung, before cutting the thread. Then the officiating minister shall say:
Pastor: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ, the Love of God, and the Communion of the Holy Spirit, be with you all. Amen.

elements.title: Shall then continue thus
elements.text: Beloved brothers and sisters, we are gathered today to consecrate this church for the worship of God Almighty, and for the edification of the body of our Lord Jesus, that is His elect people. From now may this place remain a place where God s people shall meet, a place where the gospel is proclaimed through preaching and the sacraments administered. Let it be a place where the message of life and hope unto us and all who live around shall be preached.

elements.title: Let us Pray
elements.text:
O Lord, everlasting and merciful God, we give You thanks for this your fatherly goodness that You have enabled us to build this house which is now to be consecrated to your glory. We pray You by your Holy Spirit to strengthen our faith in your only-begotten Son Jesus Christ, to fix our hearts upon your Holy Word and to unite us in devout prayer, so that we may consecrate this house aright, and graciously grant that it may always be a holy place where your eternal blessings shall issue unto this your congregation with comfort and help in life and in death. This we ask in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. Amen.
(The officiant shall request the chairman of the building committee to give him/her the key; and shall give it to the chairman of the council who shall open the door. When cutting the thread the officiant shall say:
Pastor: Peace be unto this house
Congregation: And peace unto all who shall enter therein.
Pastors and worshippers shall enter and sit.
Pastor shall read Psalm 122
I was glad when they said unto me: Let us go to the house of the Lord. Our feet shall stand within your gates, O Jerusalem; Jerusalem is built as a city that is compact together where the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord; unto the testimony of Israel to give thanks unto the Name of the Lord. For there are set thrones of judgment, the thrones of the house of David. Pray for the peace of Jerusalem, they shall prosper that love you. Peace be within your walls, and prosperity within your palaces. For my brethren and companions sakes I will now say: peace be within you. Because of the house of the Lord our God: I will seek your good.
The pastor shall go to the baptismal font.
Pastor: All the work of Your hands shall praise You, O Lord.
Congregation: All Your faithful servants shall bless You
(Three pastors shall one after the other say:)
We shall consecrate this baptismal font unto the Lord by reading from the Gospel according to Matthew 28:19-20.

elements.title: Thereafter shall lay his hand on the baptismal font saying
Let us Pray
Let us Pray
elements.text:
Blessed is You O Lord God, King of heaven and earth. You showed your love for your creation in your Word our Lord Jesus Christ. Through His admonition we seek to hold unto the truth, and the knowledge of your will. Sanctify the lips of those who shall bring forth your Word here, give them grace that we may hear your Love in all messages to be delivered from this Pulpit which we consecrate this day. Through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one true God, world without end. Amen.
We shall consecrate this Altar unto the Lord by reading from Hebrews 9:11-14.

elements.title: Thereafter shall lay his hand on the Altar saying
Let us Pray
elements.text: Blessed is You O Lord God, King of heaven and earth. You feed your people with spiritual bread in Jesus Christ our Lord. Bless and sanctify all who shall receive His Body and Blood on this altar which we consecrate this day. Give them the grace to lead their life in faith and love as long as they live here on earth, up to the time they shall see You face to face at your altar in heaven where Saints and angels praise You forever, through Jesus Christ our Lord, who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one God world without end. Amen.

elements.title: The Pastor officiating shall stand in the centre of the Church and say
Let us Pray
elements.text:
Blessed is You O Lord God, King of heaven and earth. Heavens and earth have no power to receive You. All the same, You will it to have a house on earth where your honour dwells, and where men may continually call upon You, be pleased to hallow and bless with your visitation and presence this house which we devoutly consecrate to the honour of your Name. When we pray to You and implore your mercy, give ear, O Lord to our supplications. When your servants preach your Word and administer the Sacraments here, be You in our midst. Draw near and live among us always and so lead your servants. O God, give us your grace and blessings now as we consecrate this house for the edification and honour and service to your people in the Name of the Father and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
Pastor: This church building is now open (consecrated). Let us begin our service in this church with opening prayer.
(An elder of the Church shall say the opening prayer and the service shall continue in the order of Sunday service).
Prayer for Consecration of Places not Consecrated for Worship
Pastor: According to our Lutheran tradition, we do not perform holy rites in a place that is not consecrated. That is the reason; we do consecrate new Church building before we continue with other holy rites.
But the great Professor Dr. Martin Luther, through whom this Church called Lutheran came into being, said, wherever believers are gathered to hear the word of God, be it in the home or in an open place or specified place, all is the same, for the building is not the important thing. What makes the gathering of believers holy is the word of God and the holy sacraments (that is baptism and the Lord s Supper).
Now we shall consecrate this altar with prayer where we shall ordain our new pastors and also administer the Lord s Supper.

elements.title: Let us pray
elements.text:
Blessed is you O Lord God, King of heaven and earth. You feed Your people with spiritual bread in Jesus Christ our Lord, consecrate those who shall receive the Body of Jesus and the Blood of Jesus on this altar which we consecrate this day, and also bless them. Give them the grace to lead their life in faith and love as long as they live here on earth, up to the time we shall see You face to face at Your altar in heaven where Saints and angels praise You for ever through Jesus Christ our Lord, Who lives and reigns with You and the Holy Spirit, one God world without end. Amen.
Order for the Installation of a Pastor
Before a person is ordained into the pastoral ministry, he/she most have finish pastoral training, and is called by a District into the pastoral ministry, with the approval of the General Church Council. The General Church Council shall duly License him/her, with the authority to carry out his/her pastoral duties, the District council shall also give him/her a Call letter, stating their willingness to call him/her to serve as a pastor in the district. When the pastor shall be installed in his/her District, or is transferred to another district, the following procedure shall be followed:
The Dean shall install him/her into the pastoral work during Sunday Worship in a Church within the district. Pastors and Church elders shall in procession march to the Church in twos. The new pastor shall sit with the Church elders near the chancel, while the Dean shall go to the altar. The order of Sunday Worship shall be followed. After the affirmation of faith (the Creed; the Dean and the new pastor shall stand side by side at the Chancel. The officiating Dean shall make some comments, and then read the content of the license and the call to the hearing of the congregation.

elements.title: Thereafter the dean shall say
elements.text:
Now I install Pastor name into the pastoral ministry in name of District in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
(Thereafter the newly installed pastor shall continue with the remaining part of the Sunday Worship. After that the pastors and Church elders, shall march out first in reverse order followed by the worship).
Order for the Installation of other Officials
(Catechist, Evangelist, Church Council)
(This shall be performed during Sunday Worship. After reciting the Creed, the person or persons to be installed shall come forward and stand in front of the chancel. The pastor shall ask him/her/them one by one).
Pastor: Do you believe in God the Father, the Son and the Holy Spirit as we confess in the Creed?
(Answer: Yes I will)
Pastor: Will you preach the word of God and all its doctrines in accordance with Holy Scripture and the doctrines of our Church?
(Answer: Yes I will)
Pastor: Will you promise, with God s help to seek for sinners, and lead them unto salvation, and you yourself shall lead exemplary life, serving as a good model for others?
(Answer: Yes I will, so help me God)
Pastor: Will you promise to be obedient to the leadership of the Church and all the rules of the Church, and strive to unite all members of the Church under one flock?
(Answer: I will, so help me God).
(the person shall then kneel, and the pastor with laying on of hands shall say:)
Pastor: May God help you discharge your work as (Catechist, Evangelist, Church Elder) whole heartedly to the glory of God. Amen.
Our Father who art in heaven; Hallowed be Your Name, Your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For Yours is the kingdom, the power, and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
Receiving into Fellowship a member from another
Denomination other than Lutheran
We have fellowship with other Denominations and fellowships and Denominations who are in the Council of Evangelical Churches of Northern Nigeria (LECNN) and the Christian Council of Nigeria (CCN) and the Fellowship of the Churches of Christ in Nigeria (FCCN-TEKAN). That is, if a member from member Churches of these bodies visits or comes to stay with us, we shall allow him/her partake of the Lord s Supper with us even though he/she shall not be giving a membership card immediately.
This is the procedure to be followed to receive a member from another Denomination:-
Church elders of the Local Congregation together with the pastor shall investigate whether he/she is baptized, requesting for the baptismal card, transfer and character attestation letter.
Shall under go catechistical instruction especially on Lutheran understanding on the Sacraments.
Shall declare his/her willingness to obey the teachings and traditions of our Church.
They shall test him/her just the way baptismal candidates are tested, after all these steps are carried out, then he/she shall be received into our Church during Sunday worship.
Pastor: Shall say, now we shall receive this person from another Church into our Church.
(The person who wants to be received, shall come forward and stand before the chancily, the pastor shall ask him/her):
What is your name?
Were you baptized in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit?
Answer: Yes, I was.
Do you renounce the devil with all his works and all his ways?
Answer: Yes, I renounce.
Do you believe in God the Father Almighty, Maker of heaven and earth?
Answer: Yes, I believe.
Do you believe in Jesus Christ His only Son our Lord, who was conceived of the Holy Spirit, Born of the Virgin Mary, suffered under Pontius Pilate, was crucified, dead and buried; He descended into hell, the third day He rose again from the dead, He ascended into heaven and is seated on the right hand of God the Father Almighty, from there He shall come to judge the living and the dead?
Answer: Yes, I believe.
Do you believe in the Holy Spirit, the Holy Christian Church, the Communion of Saints, the forgiveness of sins, the Resurrection of the body, and life everlasting?
Answer: Yes, I believe.
Will you promise with the help of God to obey the teachings and rules of our Church?
Answer: Yes, I will, so help me God.

elements.title: Pastor: Therefore kneel down, (the pastor shall with laying of hands say)
elements.text:
-Name we receive you now into our Church in the Name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit. Amen.
God Almighty, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ who already received you into holy baptism, may He uphold you in the grace of your baptism, may He strengthen you in your faith from now, and to the end of your earthly life. Amen.
Our Father who art in heaven; hallowed be Your Name. Your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For Yours is the kingdom, the power and the glory, for ever and ever. Amen.
(It is good that a membership card be given to him/her and the pastor shall shake hands with him/her saying: may God help you).
Dedication of a New House
Pastor and the people outside
Pastor: Peace unto this house and all who shall enter there in.
Reading: By wisdom a house is built, and through understanding it is established. Through knowledge its rooms are filled with rare and beautiful treasures (Proverbs 24:3-4).
A candle shall be lighted.
Reading: You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden. Neither do people light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead they put it on its stand, and it gives light to everyone in the house. In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good works and glorify your Father in heaven. (Matthew 5:14-16).

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
O Lord, just as this candle gives light to this house, we implore You to let the occupants of this house be Your light in the world, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.
Pastor: At the door
Reading: The Lord shall guard your going out and your coming in from now and forever. (Psalm 121:8).

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
O Lord, protect and lead those who shall live here, there going out and coming in. And let them show the generosity of this house to all who shall visit, so that they may know your love and peace, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.
Pastor: At the sitting room
Reading: New commandment I give unto you, love one another. And by this all people shall know you are my disciples, if you love one another. (John 13:34-35)

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
O Lord, abide with those who shall come for fellowship and conversation, so that they may have new strength and peace, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.

elements.title: Pastor: At the kitchen
elements.text: Reading: Look, I am sending you grain, new wine and oil enough to satisfy you fully. Be glad, O children of Zion, rejoice in the Lord your God. (Joel 2:19a, 23a).

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
O Lord, fill the hungry with good things. And let Your blessing upon those who shall work in this kitchen. Help us all to give thanks for our daily bread, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.

elements.title: Pastor: At the Dinning room
elements.text: Reading: You open your hand, and satisfy the desires of every living thing. (Psalm 145:16).

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
Blessed is You, O God of heaven and earth, for You give us what to eat and what to drink, so as to strengthen our bodies, and gladden our hearts. Help us to be thankful to You because of Your blessings unto us, help us to remember the needs of others, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.

elements.title: Pastor: At the bed room
elements.text: Reading: I will lie down and sleep in peace, for You alone O Lord make me dwell in safety. (Psalm 4:8)

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
Lead us O Lord in our daily stay and work, direct our time of sleep, so that during the day we shall remain watchful with Christ, and at night we shall rest in peace.
Crowd: Amen.
(When you go back to the sitting room, the service shall end with benediction).
Reading: The fruit of righteousness will be peace; the effect of righteousness will be quietness and confidence forever. My people will live in peaceful dwelling places, in secure homes, and in undisturbed places of rest. (Isaiah 32:17-18).

elements.title: Pastor: Let us pray
elements.text:
O God, we implore You to bless this house and all who shall dwell in it with Your ever faithful presence, so that Your love shall strengthen them; Your wisdom direct them; Your truth shall lighten them; and Your peace shall bless them, through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Crowd: Amen.

elements.title: Pastor: O Lord, remember us in your kingdom, and teach us to pray
elements.text:
Our father, who art in heaven; hallowed be Your Name,. Your kingdom come. Your will be done on earth as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread; and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For yours is the kingdom, the power and the glory, for ever and ever.
Crowd: Amen.
Pastor: The Lord guard your going out and your coming in, from now and forever.
Crowd: Amen.
* Here the minister takes the plate with the Bread in his hand
** Here the minister takes the chalice with the wine in his hand
